things.config

Class ThingWriters

  • java.lang.Object
    • things.config.ThingWriters

  • public class ThingWriters
extends Object

    Collection class for all ThingWriters that are used in this application.

    Writers are registered using a matcher-string in the format:

    [type-matcher]/[key-matcher]

    That means, for example if you want to add a writer for all things of type ‘person’, you’d register the writer using:

    person/*

    If you only have one writer for your whole application, you can just add it via:

    * / * (without white-spaces)

    If you want to use a writer for all things of type ‘person’, where the person key ends with ‘a’, you could do:

    person/*a

    And so on…

    Only one writer can ever be returned for a registered type/key combination, so make sure there is no overlap.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThingWriters

        public ThingWriters()

    • Method Detail

      • addWriter

        public void addWriter(String matcher,
                      ThingWriter writer)

        Add a writer and register it against a type/key-matcher.

        Parameters:
        matcher - the matcher (e.g. ‘person/‘), if the 2nd part of the matcher is omitted (e.g. ‘person’), ’/’ will be added (resulting in: ‘person/*’)
        writer - the writer object

      • getUnique

        public ThingWriter getUnique(String queryType,
                             String queryKey)

        Get the single writer that matches the specfied type/key combination.

        Both type and key in put can be a glob, but don’t need to be. Whether or not a reader is returned depends on the outcome of a two-way match of registered matcher-token of the reader and the specified type/key combination.

        Parameters:
        queryType - the query type or type matcher
        queryKey - the query key or key matcher
        Returns:
        the unqiue writer that matches the specfied type/key combination
        Throws:
        TypeRuntimeException - if no, or multiple writers are found for the specified type/key combination
